messages.subject: Re: the latest issue of Rekishi-Gunzo
messages.msgSnippet: I wish...!  The osprey books are probably the best you can find in English that are similar to the Rekishi Gunzo series.  Check out Sekigahara 1600 by A.J.
messages.messageBody:
I wish...! The "osprey" books are probably the best you can find in
English that are similar to the Rekishi Gunzo series. Check
out "Sekigahara 1600" by A.J. Bryant for a good treatment. You can
easily find it on amazon.com.


--- In samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com, ICPninja67@a... wrote:
> <PRE>are there any of the rekishi-gunzo series translated to
english? and if so,
> where can i purchase them?

messages.subject: Re: the latest issue of Rekishi-Gunzo
messages.msgSnippet: I ve ordered books from Amazon.co.jp before, it was only about 12$ US for shipping, and I got it in less than two weeks.  Good service. Most Japanese
messages.messageBody:
I've ordered books from Amazon.co.jp before, it was only about 12$ US
for shipping, and I got it in less than two weeks. Good service.
Most Japanese bookstores in the USA also carry them (Kinokuniya,
etc.) Thats where I've picked up most of mine.

Sent: Sunday, December 22, 2002 8:32 AM
Subject: [samuraihistory] the latest issue of Rekishi-Gunzo


> Hello group!
> I've just purchased the special issue of Rekishi Gunzo
> series,`Zusetsu Sengoku Kattyuu Syu`(Visual Colection Armours and
> Helmets` .
> It's really great,full of beautiful yoroi,kabuto,jinbaori,gunbai and
> more.I have never seen any book that includes more pics of armours
> than this.All pages are full-coloured.
>
> It costs 2100yen(not including tax).
